uniqueRequirements: Kyleigh's Law: Drivers under 21 with a permit or probationary license must display red reflectorized decals on the top left corner of both license plates
GDL curfew: No driving between 11:01 PM and 5:00 AM (Under 21)
New 2025 Requirement: Under-21 permit holders must complete 50 hours of supervised practice driving (10 at night) before getting a probationary license
6 Point ID Verification required for all licenses

questions.questionText: Under the GDL (Graduated Driver License) law, a motorist under 21 with a probationary license must strictly adhere to the following driving hours:

answers.text: No driving between 11:01 PM and 5:00 AM
No driving between 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM
No driving between Midnight and 5:00 AM
No driving between 9:00 PM and 6:00 AM

questions.explanation: Holders of a validated Special Learner Permit or Probationary License under 21 are restricted from driving between 11:01 PM and 5:00 AM.

questions.questionText: The holder of a validated GDL Special Learner Permit or Examination Permit (under 21) must meet which of the following requirements before obtaining a Probationary License?
questions.explanation: To upgrade to a Probationary License, you must be at least 17, pass a road test, and have completed 6 months of supervised driving without suspensions.

questions.questionText: Under New Jersey law, you may not park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: You must not park within 10 feet of a fire hydrant.

questions.questionText: Any vehicle operated by a GDL driver under 21 must display:

answers.text: 1 reflective red decal on the rear license plate
1 reflective red decal on the front license plate
1 reflective red decal on the top left corner of both the front and rear license plates
A 'Student Driver' magnet on the bumper

questions.explanation: Kyleigh's Law requires any vehicle operated by a GDL driver under 21 to display two visible red reflective decals, distributed to the top left corner of the front and rear license plates.

questions.questionText: The passenger restrictions for a Probationary Driver License holder (under 21) are:

answers.text: Dependents of the probationary license holder and one additional person, unless accompanied by a parent/guardian
Only one parent or guardian allowed
Any number of passengers if they are all over 21

questions.explanation: Probationary license holders are limited to dependents plus one additional passenger, unless accompanied by a parent or guardian.

questions.questionText: A motorist who changes addresses must report this change to the MVC within:
questions.explanation: Motorists who change their address must report the change to the MVC within one week after moving.

questions.questionText: Drivers must use their headlights:

answers.text: One hour after sunset and one hour before sunrise
Between one-half hour after sunset and one-half hour before sunrise and whenever visibility is 500 feet or less

questions.explanation: Headlights must be used between one-half hour after sunset and one-half hour before sunrise. They must also be used when visibility is 500 feet or less and when using windshield wipers.

questions.questionText: If a person has been drinking, what is the only thing that can sober them up?
questions.explanation: Only time will allow your body to process and eliminate alcohol. Coffee, food, and showers do not speed up the process.

questions.questionText: Under New Jersey law, motorists signaling a right turn must yield to which of the following individuals?
questions.explanation: Motorists must yield to all oncoming traffic and pedestrians, including bicyclists, skateboarders, and inline skaters.

questions.questionText: During rain, snow, or ice, all drivers must have:
questions.explanation: New Jersey law requires all motorists to turn a vehicle's headlights on whenever windshield wipers are in use.

questions.questionText: If you accumulate six or more points within three years, you are subject to a surcharge of $150. How much is the surcharge for each additional point after six?
questions.explanation: Motorists who accumulate six or more points within three years are subject to a surcharge of $150 for six points and $25 for each additional point.

questions.questionText: The New Jersey speed limit in a business or residential district, unless otherwise posted, is:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in school zones, business, or residential districts is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: Refusal of a breath test in NJ is equal to driving with a BAC of .10% and a first offense penalty of:

answers.text: Loss of license for 7 months to 1 year and an insurance surcharge of $1,000 a year for 3 years

questions.explanation: Refusing a breath test carries the same penalties as a DUI with a BAC of 0.10% or higher, including a surcharge of $1,000/year for 3 years.

questions.questionText: How much is the fine for violating any of the restrictions of the GDL Permit or Probationary License?
questions.explanation: Failure to abide by GDL restrictions (hours, passengers, decals) results in a fine of $100 or possible suspension of driving privileges.

questions.questionText: Altering a driver license, or showing an altered driver license, may result in:

answers.text: A suspension, a fine, and up to six months imprisonment

questions.explanation: Altering a license is a serious offense that can result in the loss of driving privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months imprisonment.

questions.questionText: You may not park within ___ feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 50 feet of a stop sign.

questions.questionText: To avoid 'highway hypnosis' when driving, it is a good practice to:

answers.text: Look straight ahead at all times
Avoid looking at any one thing for more than a few seconds
Rest your eyes by blinking slowly

questions.explanation: To avoid highway hypnosis, do not stare at one thing for more than a few seconds. Keep your eyes moving.

questions.questionText: The best way to enter a curve is:

answers.text: Speed up while in the curve
Slow down before entering the curve

questions.explanation: Slow down before entering a curve to avoid drifting into another lane.

questions.questionText: When driving around a sharp curve, your vehicle will tend to:
questions.explanation: Due to inertia, your vehicle will tend to keep going straight when entering a curve.

questions.questionText: In city driving, you should:
questions.explanation: In city driving, you should drive slowly, watch for pedestrians, and look at least 12 seconds ahead.

questions.questionText: To safely share the road with large trucks and buses, you must know:

answers.text: The limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances, and maneuverability

questions.explanation: Sharing the road with large trucks requires understanding their 'No-Zones' (blind spots), longer stopping distances (up to 25% longer), and wider turns.

questions.questionText: Road surfaces are most slippery:

answers.text: During the first few minutes of a rainfall
After it has been raining for an hour

questions.explanation: Roads are most slippery during the first few minutes of rainfall due to oil and dirt rising to the surface.

questions.questionText: If your wheels drift onto the shoulder of the road and you want to return to the paved road, you should:

answers.text: Turn the wheel sharply back onto the road
Speed up to get back on the road quickly

questions.explanation: Do not try to turn back onto the pavement right away. Slow down, regain control, and turn slowly onto the road.

questions.questionText: If you have a flat tire or blowout, you should:

answers.text: Remove your foot from the gas pedal
Let the vehicle coast to a stop

questions.explanation: If you experience a blowout, hold the steering wheel firmly, keep the vehicle straight while gradually slowing down, and remove your foot from the gas pedal.

questions.questionText: When driving at night, be sure that you can stop:

answers.text: Within the distance you can see ahead

questions.explanation: At night, your vision is reduced. You should drive at a speed that allows you to stop within the distance lighted by your headlights.

questions.questionText: If two cars enter an uncontrolled intersection at the same time:

answers.text: The driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right
The driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left
The driver going faster goes first

questions.explanation: At a multi-way stop or uncontrolled intersection, you must yield to the vehicle on your right if you arrive at the same time.

questions.questionText: An acceleration lane is:

answers.text: The left lane of a two-lane highway
An extra lane at a highway entrance
An extra lane at a highway exit

questions.explanation: An acceleration lane is an extra lane used by motorists entering a highway to speed up and join the flow of traffic.

questions.questionText: A deceleration lane is:

answers.text: An extra lane at a highway exit
A lane for slow drivers only

questions.explanation: A deceleration lane is an extra lane at a highway exit used to safely slow down before leaving the highway.

questions.questionText: You may not park within ___ feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 25 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.

questions.questionText: When a school bus has stopped directly in front of a school to pick up or let off children, you may pass from either direction at a speed of no more than:
questions.explanation: If a school bus has stopped directly in front of a school to pick up or drop off children, you may pass at a speed of no more than 10 mph.

questions.questionText: You should always yield to:

answers.text: Other vehicles already in the intersection

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to emergency vehicles, pedestrians, buses re-entering traffic, and vehicles already in the intersection.

questions.questionText: New Jersey's 'Move Over' law requires that:

answers.text: You stop immediately when you see police lights
You move to the lane furthest away from a stopped emergency or service vehicle, or slow down significantly if unsafe to move
You speed up to clear the area
You flash your lights at the police

questions.explanation: Drivers approaching a stationary emergency or service vehicle with flashing lights must change lanes to a lane not adjacent to the vehicle. If impossible, they must reduce speed.

questions.questionText: When you see or hear emergency vehicles responding with sirens and/or flashing lights, you must:

answers.text: Pull over to the extreme right of the roadway and stop, waiting for them to pass

questions.explanation: New Jersey law requires you to yield to emergency vehicles sounding sirens or flashing lights. Steer to the extreme right of the roadway and stop.

questions.questionText: A triangular shaped sign is a:
questions.explanation: A red and white inverted triangle is exclusively used for Yield signs.

questions.questionText: The shape of a stop sign is:
questions.explanation: A stop sign is always an eight-sided red octagon.

questions.questionText: A diamond shaped sign is a:
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond signs are warning signs; orange diamond signs are construction signs.

questions.questionText: A railroad crossing sign is:
questions.explanation: A round yellow sign with a black 'X' and 'RR' is the advance warning sign for a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: A flashing red traffic light means:

answers.text: Stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians

questions.explanation: A flashing red light means stop. Yield to traffic and pedestrians, then proceed only when safe.

questions.questionText: Double solid lines in the center of a road mean:

answers.text: Passing is allowed on both sides
Passing is allowed on one side

questions.explanation: Double solid lines indicate that passing is prohibited for vehicles in both directions.

questions.questionText: When the pavement is marked with two centerlines, one solid and one broken:

answers.text: Passing is permitted only on the side with the broken line
Passing is permitted on both sides
Passing is not permitted on either side

questions.explanation: Passing is allowed only on the side with the broken line. The solid line side cannot pass.

questions.questionText: You cannot park:

answers.text: In front of a public or private driveway

questions.explanation: Parking is illegal in all these locations: driveways, intersections, and crosswalks.

questions.questionText: Effective 2025, holders of a permit under age 21 must complete ___ hours of supervised practice driving.
questions.explanation: Under the new law effective Feb 1, 2025, permit holders under 21 must certify 50 hours of supervised driving (10 at night) before getting their probationary license.

questions.questionText: Drivers convicted of a moving violation in a construction zone are subject to:
questions.explanation: Fines are doubled for motor vehicle violations committed in the area of roadway construction zones.

questions.questionText: To maintain a proper following distance when driving, you should stay at least:

answers.text: 1 second behind the vehicle in front of you
3 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you
5 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you
100 feet behind the vehicle in front of you

questions.explanation: New Jersey recommends the 'three-second plus rule' for following distance during normal weather conditions.

questions.questionText: The implied consent law means when you operate a motor vehicle on New Jersey roads:

answers.text: You have agreed to take a breath test following an arrest for a suspected drinking and driving offense
You have agreed to let the police search your car
You have agreed to drive slowly
You have agreed to always wear a seatbelt

questions.explanation: Implied consent means simply by using NJ roads, you have agreed to submit to a breath test if arrested for suspicion of DUI.

questions.questionText: If a vehicle is passing you, you should:

answers.text: Speed up so they cannot pass
Slow down slightly to make it easier for the other motorist to pass

questions.explanation: If someone is passing you, be a defensive driver: slow down slightly and stay in your lane to help them pass safely.

questions.questionText: Habitual Offenders are those who:
questions.explanation: A Habitual Offender is a motorist whose license has been suspended three times in three years.

questions.questionText: If you sell your car (and do not buy another), what should you do with the license plates?

answers.text: Turn them into any MVC Agency or mail them to Trenton
Give them to the new owner

questions.explanation: If you sell your vehicle and terminate your insurance, you must return the plates to the MVC.

questions.questionText: When a traffic signal is hung vertically, the order of lights from top to bottom is:
questions.explanation: The standard order for a vertical traffic light is Red on top, Yellow in the middle, and Green on the bottom.

questions.questionText: A motorist should increase following distance behind a large vehicle so its driver:

answers.text: Can see the motorist's vehicle in their rearview mirrors

questions.explanation: Increase distance so the truck driver can spot you in their side-view mirrors. If you can't see their mirrors, they can't see you.

questions.questionText: Every vehicle registered in New Jersey must be insured for:
questions.explanation: Liability insurance is mandatory for every vehicle registered in New Jersey.

questions.questionText: An eight-sided sign means:
questions.explanation: The octagon (8-sided) shape is exclusively reserved for Stop signs.

questions.questionText: To steer the car while moving backward, you should turn the steering wheel:

answers.text: In the direction you want the rear of the car to go
Opposite the direction you want to go

questions.explanation: When backing up, turn the wheel in the direction you want the rear of the vehicle to go.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within how many feet of a crosswalk at an intersection?
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 25 feet of a crosswalk.

questions.questionText: Applying for a driverâ€™s license illegally may result in:

answers.text: Licensed suspension, fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment

questions.explanation: Illegal application for a license results in a fine of $200-$500 and possible jail time.

questions.questionText: When two or more roads join and there is no signal or regulatory device, it is good practice to:

answers.text: Reduce speed and be ready to stop

questions.explanation: At uncontrolled intersections, reduce speed and be prepared to stop for traffic.

questions.questionText: The best way to talk to other drivers on the road is to:

answers.text: Use your horn, lights, and hand signals
Roll down your window and yell

questions.explanation: Communicate intentions using turn signals, brake lights, and the horn.

questions.questionText: If you are under 21, New Jersey law states that you may be under the influence if your BAC is:
questions.explanation: NJ has zero tolerance for underage drinking and driving; any BAC over 0.01% is a violation.

questions.questionText: If your brakes suddenly fail, the first thing you should try to do is:

answers.text: Shift to a lower gear and pump the brakes

questions.explanation: Shift to a lower gear and pump the brake pedal fast and hard several times.

questions.questionText: You may turn on red unless:

answers.text: There is a 'No Turn on Red' sign posted
You are in a school zone

questions.explanation: Right on red is permitted after a full stop unless a sign prohibits it.

questions.questionText: A yellow pentagon (5-sided) sign indicates:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is exclusively for school zones and crossings.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill on a street with a curb, the vehicle's wheels should be:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the curb when parking downhill so the vehicle rolls into the curb if brakes fail.

questions.questionText: When parking uphill on a street with a curb, the vehicle's wheels should be:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels away from the curb when parking uphill so the rear of the tire hits the curb if it rolls back.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a school zone, unless otherwise posted, is:
questions.explanation: Standard school zone speed limit is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: Double solid lines in the center of a road means:
questions.explanation: Solid lines on both sides of the center mean no passing is allowed.

questions.questionText: When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights, you must:

answers.text: Stop at least 15 feet from the crossing
Slow down and look both ways
Stop only if you see a train
Speed up to beat the train

questions.explanation: Motorists must stop at least 15 feet from railroad crossings when lights are flashing.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a possible sign of an aggressive driver?

answers.text: Failing to yield to the right of way

questions.explanation: Aggressive driving includes speeding, tailgating, and erratic lane changes.

questions.questionText: Except new vehicles, your car must be inspected at either a state inspection facility or a state-licensed private inspection facility every:
questions.explanation: NJ vehicles must be inspected every 2 years.

questions.questionText: If you skid, you should:

answers.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal
Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction of the skid

questions.explanation: If the rear of the car skids, take your foot off the gas. Do not brake.

questions.questionText: After two to four drinks, alcohol begins to impair your:
questions.explanation: Alcohol affects reaction time, coordination, balance, and judgment.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit on an expressway, you should:
questions.explanation: Never back up on an expressway. Go to the next exit.

questions.questionText: A triangular sign with a clipped corner (slow moving vehicle) is what color?
questions.explanation: The slow-moving vehicle emblem is a reflective orange triangle with a red border.

questions.questionText: You are required to yield the right-of-way to:
questions.explanation: NJ law requires yielding to buses, postal vehicles, and mobility devices.

questions.questionText: When pavement is marked with 2 centerlines, 1 solid and 1 broken:

answers.text: Passing is permitted only on the side with the broken line
Passing permitted only on solid side

questions.explanation: Passing is only allowed if the broken line is on your side.

questions.questionText: New Jersey law allows up to three points to be subtracted from a motorist's point total for every year that a motorist goes without a violation or suspension:

answers.text: Though the point total will never be reduced below zero
Even if the point total goes below zero
Only if they take a defensive driving course

questions.explanation: Up to 3 points are removed for a year of clean driving, but the total cannot go below zero.

questions.questionText: Which of the following actions could lead to distracted driving?

answers.text: Adjusting the radio or CD player

questions.explanation: Any activity that takes attention away from the road is a distraction.

questions.questionText: Getting a driver license illegally may result in:

answers.text: A fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment of 30-90 days

questions.explanation: Illegal license procurement carries significant fines and potential jail time.

questions.questionText: What shape is a warning sign?
questions.explanation: Warning signs are yellow and diamond-shaped.

questions.questionText: If a motorist has a BAC .10%, the risk of causing an accident is:
questions.explanation: At 0.10% BAC, the risk of crashing increases to six times.

questions.questionText: When sharing the road with large trucks or buses, you should:

answers.text: Give more road space to a truck making a wide turn
Leave space when stopping behind a truck or bus
Maintain a consistent speed when passing

questions.explanation: Trucks make wide turns, roll back on stops, and have large blind spots.

questions.questionText: A probationary driver is probationary for how long?
questions.explanation: A motorist is on probation for 1 year after receiving a Probationary License.

questions.questionText: The best way to reduce your chances of having an alcohol-related accident is to:

answers.text: Not drive at all after drinking

questions.explanation: Abstinence from driving after drinking is the only sure way to prevent alcohol-related accidents.

questions.questionText: A sign with an orange background means:
questions.explanation: Orange signs indicate road work or construction.

questions.questionText: If you accumulate 12 to 14 points in a 24-month period, you will receive a Notice of Scheduled Suspension from the MVC. You can:

answers.text: Attend a NJ Driver Improvement Program
Surrender your license for the suspension period

questions.explanation: Upon receiving a suspension notice, you can attend a class, ask for a hearing, or accept the suspension.

questions.questionText: Which motorist is most at risk for drowsy driving?

answers.text: A motorist that is sleep deprived

questions.explanation: Drowsy driving risks include driving alone, lack of sleep, and youth.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 10 feet of a fire hydrant.

questions.questionText: If a motorist's BAC is slightly above .05%, the risk of causing an accident is:
questions.explanation: At 0.05% BAC, the risk of a crash doubles.

questions.questionText: When approaching a curve, your vehicle may tend to:
questions.explanation: Inertia causes the vehicle to want to continue in a straight line.

questions.questionText: The holder of a validated GDL Special Learner Permit must not drive between the hours of:
questions.explanation: Learner Permit holders under 21 are restricted from 11:01 PM to 5:00 AM.

questions.questionText: You can reduce your chances of being involved in an accident by knowing and using the standard accident prevention formula:

answers.text: Be alert, be prepared, act in time
Be angry, be fast, act late

questions.explanation: The standard prevention formula is Be Alert, Be Prepared, Act in Time.

questions.questionText: If the driver of a large truck or bus cannot see you in his rearview mirrors, you are:

answers.text: In the truck's no-zone or blind spot

questions.explanation: If you cannot see the driver's mirrors, you are in their blind spot (No-Zone).

questions.questionText: A supervising driver for the holder of a validated GDL Permit must meet which of the following requirements?

answers.text: Must be a New Jersey licensed driver seated in the front seat
Must be licensed for a minimum of 3 years

questions.explanation: Supervising drivers must be 21+, have a valid NJ license, and 3 years driving experience.

questions.questionText: Unless a no-turn on red sign is posted, NJ law allows a right turn on red after:

answers.text: Making a full stop and checking traffic

questions.explanation: You must come to a complete stop and check for traffic/pedestrians before turning right on red.

questions.questionText: When you move into New Jersey from another state, you must have your vehicle inspected within:
questions.explanation: Vehicles moving to NJ must be inspected within 14 days of registration.

questions.questionText: The fine for violation of any of the restrictions of the GDL Permit or Probationary License is:
questions.explanation: Violation of GDL restrictions carries a $100 fine.

questions.questionText: When parking a vehicle facing uphill, the wheels should be:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels away from the curb (up, up, and away) so the tire hits the curb if it rolls back.

questions.questionText: Signals should be used:
questions.explanation: Use signals for turns, lane changes, and stopping/slowing.

questions.questionText: The holder of a Probationary Driver License is not permitted to use which of the following while driving:

answers.text: Cell phones, GPS, and video games

questions.explanation: Probationary drivers are prohibited from using any electronic devices, handheld or hands-free.

questions.questionText: Driving privileges will be postponed or suspended to any person 13 to 21 years of age if convicted of:

answers.text: Buying alcoholic beverages and/or driving under the influence (DUI)

questions.explanation: Graffiti, false alarms, and underage drinking/DUI can delay or suspend driving privileges for youth.

questions.questionText: A motorist should always be prepared to yield to which of the following:
questions.explanation: Yield to trains, re-entering buses, and postal vehicles.

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow light means:

answers.text: Slow down and proceed with care

questions.explanation: Flashing yellow indicates caution.

questions.questionText: When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights, you must:

answers.text: Stop at least 15 feet from the crossing

questions.explanation: Stop at least 15 feet away when lights flash.

questions.questionText: In the event of a crash or sudden stop, use of seat belts may:

answers.text: Keep you from being thrown from the car
Keep you from hitting the windshield or dashboard
Keep you from sliding off the seat and losing control of the car

questions.explanation: Seat belts prevent ejection, impact with the interior, and sliding.

questions.questionText: Which requirement must be met by the supervisor driver accompanying the holder of a validated GDL Permit?

answers.text: Must be 21 years or older and seated in the front seat
Must be a New Jersey licensed driver
Must be licensed for a minimum of 3 years

questions.explanation: Supervisor must be 21+, NJ licensed, and have 3 years experience.

questions.questionText: Diamond shaped signs are:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are diamond-shaped.

questions.questionText: If your wheels drift onto the dirt shoulder of the road and you want to return to the paved road, you should:

answers.text: Slow down, turn back onto the pavement slowly
Drive along the shoulder until you can get back on the road
Turn abruptly back onto the pavement

questions.explanation: Slow down and regain control before turning back onto the road.

questions.questionText: A Probationary Driver is probationary for how long?
questions.explanation: Probationary period is 1 year.

questions.questionText: Failure to stop for pedestrians in a crosswalk carries a fine of up to:

answers.text: $500, up to 25 days in jail, 6 months suspension, 2 points and community service

questions.explanation: Penalties for hitting pedestrians are severe, including $500 fine and jail time.

questions.questionText: A 12 oz. can of beer has as much alcohol in it as:
questions.explanation: 12oz beer = 5oz wine = 1.5oz liquor.

questions.questionText: Whether your BAC rises above legal limits depends on:

answers.text: The time you take to drink

questions.explanation: BAC depends on quantity, weight, time, and food consumed.

questions.questionText: What is a 'Habitual Offender'?

answers.text: Any motorist whose license has been suspended 3 times in 3 years

questions.explanation: 3 suspensions in 3 years defines a Habitual Offender.

questions.questionText: If a person gets drunk in your home and has a motor vehicle accident after leaving your home, you could:
questions.explanation: Hosts can be held liable if a guest drives drunk and crashes.

questions.questionText: A solid white line across a road at an intersection means:

answers.text: Stop behind the line for a traffic signal or sign

questions.explanation: A solid white line indicates where to stop at an intersection.

questions.questionText: Which of the following convictions will result in an Insurance Surcharge?

answers.text: Operating Under the Influence of Liquor/Drugs
Refusal to Take a Breathalyzer Test

questions.explanation: DUI and refusal both result in heavy insurance surcharges.

questions.questionText: The best way to 'talk' to other drivers on the road is to:

answers.text: Use your horn, lights and hand signals

questions.explanation: Use signals and horn to communicate.

questions.questionText: To safely share the road with large trucks and buses, you must know:

answers.text: The limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances and maneuverability

questions.explanation: Knowing truck limitations is key to safety.

questions.questionText: If under 21, New Jersey law states that you may be under the influence if your BAC is:
questions.explanation: 0.01% is the limit for under 21.

questions.questionText: When approaching a curve, your vehicle may tend to:
questions.explanation: Vehicles tend to go straight in curves due to inertia.

questions.questionText: Before practice driving is permitted, the permit holder must pass the required MVC's Knowledge test and Vision exam, have a validated permit and obtain:

answers.text: Two red reflectorized decals, one for each license plate

questions.explanation: Decals are required before practice driving begins.

questions.questionText: The holder of a validated GDL Special Learner Permit may not drive between the hours of:
questions.explanation: 11:01 PM to 5:00 AM restriction applies.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a motor vehicle accident that causes injury to another person while your driving privileges are suspended, you are subject to:

answers.text: A fine, continued suspension and potential jail sentence

questions.explanation: Causing injury while suspended results in severe penalties including jail.

questions.questionText: Driving while under the influence of intoxicating beverages means:

answers.text: Your senses and judgment are impaired by alcohol

questions.explanation: DUI means senses and judgment are impaired.

questions.questionText: During a probationary period, a motorist must enroll in a Probationary Driving School Program when:

answers.text: Accumulating 4 or more points and convicted of 2 or more moving violations

questions.explanation: Probationary school is required at 4 points/2 violations.

questions.questionText: Road surfaces are most slippery:

answers.text: During the first few minutes of a rainfall

questions.explanation: First few minutes of rain are slickest.

questions.questionText: The meaning of a hand signal when a driver's hand and arm are straight out is:
questions.explanation: Arm straight out means Left Turn.

questions.questionText: Upon completion of the GDL requirements, (one year of supervised driving) the holder of a Probationary License must:

answers.text: Visit any MVC agency to obtain an unrestricted Basic License

questions.explanation: You must visit MVC to upgrade to a Basic License after probation.

questions.questionText: If your license plates are lost or stolen, you should immediately notify:
questions.explanation: Report lost plates to police immediately.

questions.questionText: To safely share the road with large trucks and buses, you must know:

answers.text: The limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances and maneuverability

questions.explanation: Know truck limitations for safety.

questions.questionText: Excluding dependents, how many passengers may accompany the holder of a validated GDL Special Learner Permit in the vehicle?

answers.text: One additional person unless accompanied by a parent or guardian

questions.explanation: Learner Permit holders can have 1 additional passenger unless a parent is present.

questions.questionText: Getting a driver license illegally may result in:

answers.text: A fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment of 30-90 days

questions.explanation: Illegal license procurement leads to fines and jail.

questions.questionText: Before entering an intersection and nearing a yellow or amber traffic signal, you should:
questions.explanation: Stop for yellow if safe; otherwise proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: The vehicle used for the road test may not have:

answers.text: Any obstructions or consoles between the driver and the examiner

questions.explanation: Examiner must have access to the brake.

questions.questionText: If you drive 50 mph, your stopping distance is about:
questions.explanation: At 50 mph, total stopping distance is approx 247 feet on dry pavement.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a possible sign of an aggressive driver?

answers.text: Improper or erratic traffic lane changes

questions.explanation: Aggressive driving includes many erratic behaviors.

questions.questionText: Emotions can have a great effect on your driving: if you are angry or excited, you should:

answers.text: Give yourself time to cool off

questions.explanation: Cool off before driving if emotional.

questions.questionText: If you have a flat tire or blowout, you should:
questions.explanation: Hold wheel firmly and coast to stop.

questions.questionText: In city driving, you should:
questions.explanation: Drive slowly and alertly in cities.

questions.questionText: You may not park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?
questions.explanation: 10 feet from hydrant.

questions.questionText: When checking your blind spot, you should:

answers.text: Turn your head and look over your shoulder

questions.explanation: Physically turn head to check blind spots.

questions.questionText: High beam lights are used for:
questions.explanation: High beams are for open country driving when no other cars are present.

questions.questionText: How many points for tailgating?
questions.explanation: Tailgating is a 5-point violation.

questions.questionText: Fine for failing to yield to a pedestrian in a crosswalk:
questions.explanation: Up to $500 fine for failing to yield to pedestrians.

questions.questionText: A yellow pennant shaped sign means:
questions.explanation: Pennant indicates start of no passing zone.

questions.questionText: NJ law requires you to keep to the right except:
questions.explanation: Keep right except when passing.

questions.questionText: You must stop ___ feet from a school bus with flashing red lights.
questions.explanation: Stop at least 25 feet away from a school bus.

questions.questionText: If your gas pedal sticks:
questions.explanation: Shift to neutral and steer off road.

questions.questionText: Studded snow tires are legal between:
questions.explanation: Studded tires allowed Nov 15 - Apr 1.

questions.questionText: Parking distance from a curb:
questions.explanation: Park within 6 inches of curb.

questions.questionText: How far must you stop from a railroad crossing?
questions.explanation: Stop at least 15 feet from railroad.

questions.questionText: Points for failing to observe traffic signal:
questions.explanation: Failure to observe traffic signal is 2 points.
